intro: Psychotria lebronnecii, commonly known as the "Coca plant" in some regions, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Psychotria lebronnecii is notable for its role in traditional medicine and its association with the cultivation of coca leaves.
